cip.render

Class DynXmlObjLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.DynXmlObjLoader

  • public final class DynXmlObjLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the loader for dynamically loaded objects from XML files. The general form of the object specification in the XML file is:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="className" name="objectName"gt;
           .
         object specific node content
           .
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    IDynXmlObject

    • Method Detail

      • LoadObject

        public static java.lang.Object LoadObject(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                                          @Nullable
                                          @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                                   throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Load a dynamically loaded object from an XML description. The XML description includes a class that will be instantiated. Once an object of that class is instantiated, it will be tested to see if it implements the IDynXmlObject interface. If so, it is loaded from the XML node.
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The XML node containing the description of the object.
        refObjectList - A linked list of previously loaded named objects. The loaded object is added to this list if the object is loaded successfully. This list is passed to the object being loaded so that object references can be resolved.
        Returns:
        Returns the instantiated and initialized object.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error instantiating and/or loading the object from the node.
